publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-913# David McLetchie: Milestone House Hospice—That the Parliament notes with concern the proposal to close Milestone House in Edinburgh, Scotland’s only hospice for AIDS sufferers, and urges the Scottish Executive to initiate discussions with Lothian Health Board, the City of Edinburgh Council and Waverley Care Trust with a view to devising a funding package which recognises that it is a national facility equipped to meet the needs of patients and their families Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald*, Mary Scanlon*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) David Mundell*, Donald Gorrie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Andrew Wilson*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Alex Neil*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Ben Wallace*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-913# David McLetchie: Milestone House Hospice-That the Parliament notes with concern the proposal to close Milestone House in Edinburgh, Scotland's only hospice for AIDS sufferers, and urges the Scottish Executive to initiate discussions with Lothian Health Board, the City of Edinburgh Council and Waverley Care Trust with a view to devising a funding package which recognises that it is a national facility equipped to meet the needs of patients and their families Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Mary Scanlon, David Mundell, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Mr Michael McMahon, Christine Grahame, Ben Wallace, Scott Barrie, Bill Aitken*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Alex Fergusson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Nick Johnston*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Mr Keith Harding*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Kay Ullrich*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-913# David McLetchie: Milestone House Hospice-That the Parliament notes with concern the proposal to close Milestone House in Edinburgh, Scotland's only hospice for AIDS sufferers, and urges the Scottish Executive to initiate discussions with Lothian Health Board, the City of Edinburgh Council and Waverley Care Trust with a view to devising a funding package which recognises that it is a national facility equipped to meet the needs of patients and their families Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Mary Scanlon, David Mundell, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Mr Michael McMahon, Christine Grahame, Ben Wallace, Scott Barrie, Bill Aitken, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Alex Fergusson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nick Johnston, Shona Robison, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Kay Ullrich, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson, Phil Gallie*, Robin Harper*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Pauline McNeill*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-913# Milestone House Hospice (lodged on 25 May 2000) Michael Russell*, Mike Watson*

S1M-913# David McLetchie: Milestone House Hospice—That the Parliament notes with concern the proposal to close Milestone House in Edinburgh, Scotland’s only hospice for AIDS sufferers, and urges the Scottish Executive to initiate discussions with Lothian Health Board, the City of Edinburgh Council and Waverley Care Trust with a view to devising a funding package which recognises that it is a national facility equipped to meet the needs of patients and their families Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Mary Scanlon, David Mundell, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Mr Michael McMahon, Christine Grahame, Ben Wallace, Scott Barrie, Bill Aitken, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Alex Fergusson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nick Johnston, Shona Robison, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Kay Ullrich, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson, Phil Gallie, Robin Harper, Pauline McNeill, Fiona McLeod, Michael Russell, Mike Watson
